timeline.bodyText: I would really prefer to always include the braces
timeline.author: martinvw

replies.bodyText: I did not want to touch existing coding, but I agree with you and will add braces around the throw.
replies.author: MHerbst

timeline.bodyText: Can this be matched more exact than contains, what are possible values?
timeline.author: martinvw

replies.bodyText: There a names with TEMPERATURE at the end and also names with TEMPERATURE in the middle. All datapoints with possibly missing units have in common that they are defined as float and contain "TEMPERATURE". I could check the documentation whether it makes sense to limit it more.
replies.author: MHerbst

replies.bodyText: Replaced by regex that is more restrictive :-)
replies.author: MHerbst

timeline.message:
Bypass for a HM problem with empty unit for temperature data points

Some HMIP devices return an empty "unit" for temperature data points.
This fix sets the unit to °C for all temperature data points of type
float.

Fixes #6102

Signed-off-by: Martin Herbst <develop@mherbst.de>

Make test for device name case-insensitive

solves #6783


Signed-off-by: Martin Herbst <develop@mherbst.de>

Some smaller markdown syntax corrections


Signed-off-by: Martin Herbst <develop@mherbst.de>

According to https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/issues/6847
